snippet: Over the course of the weekend, consumers spent about $1.7 billion less on holiday shopping than they did the year before, according to the National Retail Federation.
abstract: National Retail Federation reports consumers spent about $1.7 billion less on holiday shopping than they did in previous year; economy's lackluster pace, along with shorter-than-usual window between Thanksgiving and Christmas, pushed sales and promotions to begin weeks before Thanksgiving Day, leaving customary Black Friday kickoff looking somewhat dismal.

byline.contributor: Alan Blinder and Ken Maguire contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Over the course of the weekend, consumers spent about $1.7 billion less on holiday shopping than they did the year before, according to the National Retail Federation.

headline.main: Gloomy Numbers for Holiday Shopping’s Big Weekend
headline.print_headline: Gloomy Numbers for Holiday Shopping’s Big Weekend
